| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | [SpliceHack 1.2.0 - monst.c, line 2320](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.2.0/src/monst.c#L2320) |

A **yellow moldier**, F, formerly known as a **yellow mold warrior**, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The yellow moldier is a type of [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [mold](/wiki/Mold "Mold") with similar traits to the [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold"), and like all [moldiers](/wiki/Moldier "Moldier") it is capable of [following](/wiki/Follow "Follow") the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to other levels while it is adjacent.

A yellow moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed, stunning the attacker for several turns dependent on their level. Yellow moldiers possess [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and also possess [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance") like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

Eating a yellow moldier [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") always causes [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination").

## Generation

Randomly generated yellow moldiers are always created hostile. A yellow mold can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A yellow moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), and is not located within or on top of a square of [water](/wiki/Water "Water"), [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"). Corpses infected by yellow moldiers may be turned into yellow moldiers themselves.

## Strategy

Yellow moldiers should be fought using [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") in order to avoid being repeatedly stunned, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. [Copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") weapons deal extra damage to mold and fungus monsters, which can provide an important edge against moldiers in general. When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. [eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") them, feeding them to [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.

## Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified  
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.  
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.  
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)  
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

\[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

Yellow moldier

From NetHackWiki

F yellow moldier (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d4 physical, passive 0d4 stun
F yellow moldier (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d4 physical, passive 0d4 stun

Base level 5
Base experience ?
Speed 12
Base AC 8
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 200
Size Medium
Resistances sleep (SpliceHack only), poison, sickness
Resistances conveyed causes hallucination

A yellow moldier:

  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
Reference SpliceHack 1.2.0 - monst.c, line 2320

A yellow moldier, F, formerly known as a yellow mold warrior, is a type of monster that appears in SpliceHack-Rewrite and Hack'EM. The yellow moldier is a type of humanoid mold with similar traits to the yellow mold, and like all moldiers it is capable of following the hero to other levels while it is adjacent.

A yellow moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a passive attack that can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed, stunning the attacker for several turns dependent on their level. Yellow moldiers possess poison resistance and also possess sickness resistance like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess sleep resistance.

Eating a yellow moldier corpse or tin always causes hallucination.

Generation

Randomly generated yellow moldiers are always created hostile. A yellow mold can grow up into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A yellow moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not acidic, and is not located within or on top of a square of water, ice or lava. Corpses infected by yellow moldiers may be turned into yellow moldiers themselves.

Strategy

Yellow moldiers should be fought using ranged attacks in order to avoid being repeatedly stunned, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. Copper weapons deal extra damage to mold and fungus monsters, which can provide an important edge against moldiers in general. When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. eating them, feeding them to pets, etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.

Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

A '''yellow moldier''', {{yellow|F}}, formerly known as a '''yellow mold warrior''', is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The yellow moldier is a type of [[humanoid]] [[mold]] with similar traits to the [[yellow mold]], and like all [[moldier]]s it is capable of [[follow]]ing the [[hero]] to other levels while it is adjacent.

A yellow moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a [[passive attack]] that can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed, stunning the attacker for several turns dependent on their level. Yellow moldiers possess [[poison resistance]] and also possess [[sickness resistance]] like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess [[sleep resistance]].

Eating a yellow moldier [[corpse]] or [[tin]] always causes [[hallucination]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated yellow moldiers are always created hostile. A yellow mold can [[grow up]] into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A yellow moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [[acidic]], and is not located within or on top of a square of [[water]], [[ice]] or [[lava]]. Corpses infected by yellow moldiers may be turned into yellow moldiers themselves.

==Strategy==
Yellow moldiers should be fought using [[ranged attack]]s in order to avoid being repeatedly stunned, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. [[Copper]] weapons deal extra damage to mold and fungus monsters, which can provide an important edge against moldiers in general. When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. [[eating]] them, feeding them to [[pet]]s, etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.
